content: And again, it's how -- if you can guarantee a lead time and you can't effectively give a price and you know interest rates are going up, it's tough for folks to get really aggressive in terms of what they're looking at. I mean when you're clocking $500 million a quarter that's a good clip for us when you think about what our deliveries have been in the last five, six years. I think China is going to be a bigger challenge even as we get into the second half, because we don't forget there's a lot of – there are a lot of boats on the water, so we haven't really seen the worst of the worst yet coming from China. When you think about our unit level even at say throwing out a number $1.8 billion, I mean, we still -- that's a lot of cranes we've got to make in the footprint we have.
